intro: Symphytum almagroi, commonly known as the Almagro prop根草, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with glandular hairs, while its flowers are clustered in cymes. Symphytum almagroi is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
